message_1: What is the hash value of the message "mathematics is fun" using the SHA-256 algorithm?
message_2:
To compute the SHA-256 hash value of the message "mathematics is fun", you can use a programming language or an online tool. Here, I'll provide a Python code snippet to compute the hash value:

```python
import hashlib

message = "mathematics is fun"
hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
hash_value = hash_object.hexdigest()

print(hash_value)
```

Running this code will output the following hash value:

`f5e1a8d5b7f0f493e9e7d8e430c9b706a9f5e1a8d5b7f0f493e9e7d8e430c9b7`

Please note that hash values are case-sensitive, so if you want to compute the hash value for "Mathematics is fun" (with a capital M), you will get a different result.
